plant_translocations.content: Absorption, translocation, and metabolism of the methyl ester of 14C-flamprop (flamprop-methyl) and 14C-barban in wild oat (Avena fatua L.) were investigated to understand the synergistic interaction between these herbicides. The addition of barban formulation additives, technical barban, or the nonionic surfactant polyoxyethylene 6-tridecylether increased the absorption of 14C-flamprop-methyl. Translocation of 14C-flamprop-methyl was mainly acropetal, unaffected by the addition of barban. Barban absorption increased with the addition of flamprop-methyl and polyoxyethylene-6-tridecylether. However, translocation and metabolism of the herbicides were not significantly influenced by each other. This study suggests that increased absorption of both herbicides is the primary mechanism driving their synergistic interaction in wild oat.
plant_translocations.reference: Sharma, M. P., Qureshi, F. A., & Born, W. H. V. (1982). The basis for synergism between barban and flamprop on wild oat (Avena fatua). Weed Science, 30(2), 147-152.

method.Plant Growth Condition: Seeds sown in potting mix (Malmo clay loam:sand:peat 2:1:1) in 15 cm diameter pots. Grown in greenhouse at 24°C day/16°C night, 16 h photoperiod with supplemental lighting. Thinned to 3 uniform plants per pot after emergence.
method.Chemical Preparation: 14C-flamprop-methyl labeled in carbonyl group, 3.30 mCi/mmol specific activity. Working solution with 0.2 kg ai/ha in 25% aqueous acetone, 0.01 μCi/μL radioactivity. 14C-barban labeled in benzene ring, 9.45 mCi/mmol specific activity. Working solution with 0.15 kg ai/110 L in 25% aqueous acetone, 0.01 μCi/μL.
method.Pesticide Application Details for the Pl: Foliar spray at 0.2 and 0.3 kg ai/ha barban, 0.2 and 0.4 kg ai/ha flamprop-methyl, alone or tank-mixed. Applied in 112 L/ha water at 276 kPa with flat fan nozzle at 2 or 4-leaf wild oat stage.
method.Other Information: Randomized complete block design with 6 replicates. Foliage dry weight determined 4 weeks after treatment. For translocation, plants harvested 1-7 days after treatment, freeze-dried, autoradiographed. For 14C distribution, leaf washes and plant sections combusted and radioactivity quantified at 4 h to 7 day intervals.
